meanings.definition: To climb or move up something using a ladder or stairs.
meanings.sent1: She was escalading the ladder to reach the top shelf.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters were escalading the stairs to rescue the trapped cat.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was escalading the stairs with a big smile on her face.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like escalading a mountain of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The image of her escalading the ladder stayed in his mind.

meanings.definition: To increase rapidly in size or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The excitement was escalading as the concert start time approached.
meanings.sent2: The tension was escalading in the room as the argument grew more heated.
meanings.sent3: The laughter in the room was escalading to uncontrollable levels.
meanings.sent4: The situation was escalading like a storm brewing on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The fear was escalading within him with each passing moment.

meanings.definition: To scale or climb a wall or other obstacle.
meanings.sent1: The skilled climber was escalading the rock wall effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The thief was escalading the fence to enter the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was escalading the tree trunk in search of nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like escalading a fortress of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The image of him escalading the wall was etched in her memory.
